case.summary: The appellant appealed the trial judge's confirmation of the Assessment Officer's report assessing the respondent solicitor's bill for services -- She argued several grounds, including that the solicitor was never on record, and that he failed to protect her interests -- HELD: The appeal was dismissed -- The findings of the assessment officer were not effectively challenged and the appellant failed to demonstrate any error on the part of the officer or the trial judge -- There was no merit to the appellant's claims that the solicitor was repeatedly in violation of the procedural requirements of the Construction Lien Act -- There was no credence whatever to the allegations that the solicitor had lied to the court -- Costs on a substantial indemnity basis fixed at $4,245.
